content.detailedDescription: Was watching fireworks display across the street from my neighborhood.  and suddenly noticed a kind of dim orange light, which at first i thought that the folks across the street had accidentally set the telephone pole on fire with their fireworks. but, then i noticed that the orange light which i was seeing, was "moving" !!! i did not think it was anything other than a lantern floating in the sky.  it eventually disappeared..  it was moving very very slowly.  then, about 10 mins later, a whole stream of them, about 6 total, were coming from the opposite direction behind me, about the same height in the sky.  all orange, and not very bright.  again, i thought it was just some group of people who bought some kind of new firework or lanterns that you light and release into the sky on 4th of july.  they moved very slowly, and in a straight line, all same distance from each other.  then, as they appeared, they disappeared in the opposite order.  i again assumed that logically, they burned out (being lanterns).  well, this morning, i was trying to look around for local news articles for others like me who had seen these.. there was nothing. a guy at my work, said he saw them too, and also believed they were lanterns or something. then, i saw on youtube about several other sightings of the exact same thing! and another sighting from my town as well! so, i'm still not sure what they were, but i am very curious. are there fireworks or lanterns people light and send into the sky for july 4th? i haven't heard of such things... from looking at the realtime ufo map on this site, it's clear that i am not the only one who has seen this exact same phenomenon.  hopefully, others will come forward and tell their accounts.
content.summary: More orange lights in the sky (huntsville/madison alabama!).

content.detailedDescription: Roughly 15 minutes after the fireworks ended to the right of wallenpaupack highschool. a flaming ball was seen in the sky by several witnesses. it moved right and left for roughly 10 minutes then shot up and disappeared.
content.summary: Flaming ball zig zagged above lake wallenpaupack after fireworks.

content.detailedDescription:
Thursday morning, about 11:00 i took a break from yard work, kicked back on the patio, looking at nothing in general, when i saw it.
at first i thought it was a metallic balloon, but then realized it was going to straight and to fast.  besides, there was no wind.
there was a silver globe, which i estimate to have been about 4,000 ft. high going from wsw to ene at a high rate of speed.  it took about 4 seconds to traverse my field of view, which i estimate to be maybe 60-70 degrees.
i think that would have made it 1000-1500 mph.  i(maybe you can do the math)  it was extremely bright, like highly polished silver, enough so that even with the sun behind it, it was sill highly reflective.  
then, another object flew over, coming from the northwest (from over the house) in a large arc back to the south.  it looked like a fighter aircraft, but it made no sound.  then it disappeared over the hill behind my house. the whole sequence took less than 15 seconds.  if the objets were at the same altitude, and military jet was of the normal size, i estimate the globe to be 30-40 feet in diameter.
content.summary: Sphere/highly polished silver/est 39-40 feet in dia.

content.detailedDescription: During a 4th of july bbq, approx 10 guests spotted and orange ball in the e/se sky over the tunkhannock/falls area.  the orange glow made no sound and moved a fairly rapid speed, then stopped completely for approx 30 seconds.  it seemed to just disappear after that.  some witnesses thought they may have seen red lights going around it.  about 20-30 minutes later, the exact same event happened again.  this time, there was approx 12-15 witnesses.  two witnesses thought it may have possibly been a helicopter while others said that it didn't at all resemble one. it was a very obvious large orange glow.  i'm interested to see how many other people saw this.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Orange ball spotted in e/se sky twice in one half hour. moved rapidly. stopped for 30 seconds, then shrunk or flew away.

content.detailedDescription:
I dont know if i can put thisin writing. we were close to being back home from watching fireworks at the mall of ga. driving down hwy. 124, approaching the publix, my husband (driving) asked what something was off to the right, pointing just past hwy. 332 above some warehouses. it seemed stationary so i said it looked like one of the bigger balloons that i had seen attached to ropes when driving down the freeway as sort of an advertisement or eye-catcher. they are larger balloons tied to a really long rope but attached to a building. 

then it started moving toward us. we stopped at the 4 way stop and hesitated there watching it start to move north parallel with hwy. 332. we were going to turn left onto 332 and did but pulled into the cvs parking lot and drove behind the building still watching the movement. it seemed to start off slowly because we had time to stop at the stop sign, turn and turn into the cvs and park. the 3 of us bailed out, including my 12 year old son, still watching as it had not gotten to us but was still moving toward that direction. my son and i got our cell phones out and video taped it, moving toward us, over us at a stead pace and level and finally started to disappear over the treetops. about the time i closed my phone, my husband says, here comes another. 

i turned immediately and started to video tape the second as i told my son of the second one, he finished taping the first and turned to the second. when i turned to the second one, it was just about the same place that we had first seen the original one. the second one also moved at a steady and level rate following in what we believed to be the same exact path as the first. if i had to guess, i would say maybe 35-40 mph. as the second one moved over us, i steadily held my phone up and moved it at a slow rate above me. i could not see well as i watched the phone so i would glance away from my phone (still recording) and look at the object directly.

both objects were the same size. possibly the size of a hippty-hop bouncy toy or the size of an extra large kick ball. these did not have anything extending from the side like a meteor or from the bottom like with a hot air balloon. there was no extension like a basket or of the balloon or anything like that. only round.

to me it still seemed like this round red balloon but it had fire under it (or on the bottom) or it was just a round flame. a small fireball traveling across the sky. in discussing later, my son and husband thought it only looked like a fireball though. they did not get the impression of the balloon with the fire at the base like i did. the fire did not blow then stop blowing the like a hot air balloon would have fire blowing up from the bottom. the flame was very steady and, neither object made a noise. they were silent, absolutely no sound what so ever. 

they seemed to travel fairly close to the ground, very level, not up and down or back and forth. very steady. they seemed to be lower than the small air planes that land at our small town airport. maybe the height of 2 or 3 tall trees up? (not good at measuring distance anyway but my husband probably could give a better idea of that). 

as the second one was going further away, the fire seemed to die out some, then the flame came back. when first dying out i thought maybe we could see the flame much better from the front and not so well from the back because we were able to see it coming from a good distance away but not leaving us. but when the flame/brightness came back that once, it made me think that it was just disappearing. i don't know, it was just gone! suddenly.

my son has remote control air planes, little ones that you can buy at walmart. i know how these sound, this was no remote control item. i have seen the larger ones flown and you can hear them flying from 1/2 mile away, at least. it was no weather balloon or fireworks. it was controlled: height from the ground, mph, path, everything. we were all 3 in awe and absolutely amazed. we kept asking, what could it be? could anyone figure it out yet? it was not a flash, it took maybe 10-13 minutes while we stopped at the stop sign, drove a few feet, then stopped in the parking lot and stood out of the car watching both objects. i went to bed that night almost in tears knowing what we had seen. i am 45 and have never in my life had something so amazing that i could not come up some type of explanation. i wonder if there were others that had see them. there had to be! there was about 3 cars in the drive-thru next to where we stood and watched. these people had to have looked up to see what we were looking at and video taping with our phones. i wondered how do you call your police dept and make a report of something. when i mentioned that to my son, he was concerned that they would take him away because we were crazy but he knows what we saw was real. what, we don't know but it was real. someone would have to do a lot to prove to me that was not a ufo. it would have to be proven under the same conditions, air, moon light, time of night, etc. i would love for someone to prove it was something different!!

video attachments are noted with date and time in the title. 7/4/10_22:32 and 22:34. the second one was started from my right, then straight above me then past me to my left. the first one i could not tell you exactly because we bailed out of the car and started taping so quickly. for the second one, i know more of where i was standing and my actions since i had time to video tape the first one and realize what i might be looking at.
content.summary: Seemed stationary first. traveled over us, straight, same level. second followed when first out of sight.

content.detailedDescription:
I am resending since i am not sure if something went wrong the first time.

i had gotten home from work @ 7:35 and i had to mow and trim my yard. i got that done and i decided to water the brown spots in my yard due to the lack of rain lately. i looked up in the sky (approximately somewhere in between 9:30 to 10:30 pm) fireworks was being let off in the area here and there. at first i thought it was a firework coming closer. then i thought that is taking too long to burst. it kept getting closer and then i thought it was a helicopter or something on fire and it was going to crash. then it kinda just  started hovering. it didn't make a sound and at times the light would go completely out but you could see the object in the sky just sitting there and then it would start glowing again really bright. i took a video with my digital camera. it is a canon with a 14x zoom on it. i did zoom in but didn't get the video when it was at it's closest. you can see the corner of my house on the right when the video starts and the i zoomed in. the video doesn't do this object justice.When it left it just got a little further away and disappeared. i am not a person that has believed in ufo's and would love to find a logical explanation for this, but i can't think of one. i didn't know where to report this or i would have done it that night. i found this resource on wikipepia.
content.summary: Really bright red/orange orb

content.detailedDescription:
It was july 4th 2010 in long island, about 2 miles north of the south shore.  my girlfriend, mother and myself were sitting on the back deck near the pool watching the sky for fireworks.  around 10:35pm i noticed a star that looked like it was moving.  i asked the 2 of them if they could also see it, they did and after we all had our eyes on the moving star it turned left 90 degrees and then vanished.  in our perspective.  we commented and joked to each other that stars are not supposed to move let alone change direction and then disappear!

my mom went into the house to use the restroom leaving my girlfriend and i on the deck watching the sky.  

my girlfriend was the first to notice what happened next.

in the southern sky, not far from us (judging by the trees all around the objects had to be less than 1 mile away) we saw an orange orb flying fairly low (much lower than any plane).  with trees blocking the view of their entrance we saw the 1st orange orb fly from due west to east.  then another behind it.  then another behind that one, giving us 3 orange orbs flying in a line from west to east.  behind the 3rd orb was a small cluster of orbs, about 4 or 5 total.  they never broke their formation.  behind the cluster of 4 or 5 orbs was another 3 flying in a line just like the first three. 

by the time the first of the orbs was visible my mom returned from the house.  she heard us shouting and pointing at the orbs and she was able to also see them.

they passed our field of vision and then they were gone.

they looked like orange balls of light and emitted no sound.  they were moving pretty fast and never broke their formation, with the 3 in line at the start, group of approximately 5 in the center and 3 more finishing the tail of the formation.

we were all creeped out by the experience.  we have never seen something like this before.  we immediately knew this was not a firework of some sort, nor plane or helicopters.  they were much too low for it to be a normally identifiable object.  we remarked how they looked close enough where a rifle shot could have hit them.

just as quickly as they flew in to our view they were gone.

the rest of the night we watched the sky and witnessed 3 more stars moving through the sky, change direction and disappear, however we did not see any more of the flying orange orbs.
content.summary: ~12 orange orbs flying in formation.

content.detailedDescription: I'm afraid to go public or provide more then a general description of events. i have been in contact with a cluster of metalic luminescent spheres that respond to my laser. so far in the last 2 weeks they have returned at least 4 different days. they move in unison with six spheres in total. they approach as close as 500 feet. some of them will flash brilliant in my direction with a series of flashes. the brighter of the spheres which are of different size seems to direct the other spheres. i'm not sure if i will make more then this written report as i don't want create a public spectacle and i'm concerned that if i make it public they will not return. i'm going to borrow a camcorder and provide video evidence to this site in the near future. im absolutely sure they will return again. they stay in my vision until my laser pointer batteries start fading. last night was the closest they came to my position on the ground. i work for the feds and don't want to receive any attention in this matter but i also want to ask your viewing audience what they would do in my situation. if i talk to my friends i wonder if they will tell others. if i mention any more i wonder if the government will get involved. i have heard that a radar detector can pick up tones so i want to try and record the tones. i believe the government already knows and tries to debunk or intimidate. i'm sorry i dont want to mention any more at this time. im an avid star gazer and had an amazing sighting in 1973 that changed my life. now that im in my 50's i have finally got the confirmation i needed and maybe that's all that matters. best wishes and don't stop looking up.
content.summary: Ongoing contact...

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks in our back yard, when two bright orange glowing spheres appeared traveling west to east, then a third sphere appeared.  we thought they were part of the fireworks display, but they were moving away from the fireworks display and within 30 seconds the first one suddenly disappeared, then the second one disappeared and the third. they were identical in size, shape and color and totally separate from the fireworks display. my brother and i both saw them, and he suggested i report them to you. we were both very fascinated, and positive what we saw. they didn't change shape, and traveled in unison until they suddenly vanished as quickly as they had appeared. our first thought was that they were watching, possibly thinking earth was having a conflict (war) of some kind and they were "scout" ships, checking to see what all the explosions (fireworks) were. there was quite a large fireworks display that lasted approximately 2 hours. we watched the sky until about 2:00 am and there was no recurrence of the event.
content.summary: Orange colored spheres.

content.detailedDescription: This object did not have a smoke trail. it was silent and flew nw from austin right over butler park as we were watching fireworks. other people saw this object and yelled out a ufo. we looked up and were freaked out by what we saw. this object was traveling slow across the sky. about the speed of a 2 seater plane or slower. it was low enough that i could see the bottom of this circular craft changing colors like burning amber. i watched it disappear on the horizon but it reappear for a split second then was gone again, almost as if it had gone through a cloud and out again. but this object did not have any blinking or running lights on it. it definitely was not a plane, hot air balloon, firework, crashing satellite, or a star. this craft seemed to be under some kind of control and it just kept the same speed and elevation and flew in a straight line nw on the 4 of july at 9:35pm central time.
content.summary: Glowing red circular object like hot metal or burning amber.

content.detailedDescription: We had just returned home to nixa mo. we were out back of our duplex after returning from a 4th of july party, and had just began making a fire in our fire pit.  my girlfriend suddenly pointed south and said, "justin what is that."  i looked to the sky, and immediately saw a glowing object flying at a very high rate of speed.  i quickly noticed it didn't have any flashing beacons like normal aircraft do.  i also quickly noticed that it was moving much faster than a normal plane would be at a high elevation.  my second thought was that it was a helicopter flying at a lower elevation, but there was absolutley no sound.  it was obviously flying at a low enough elevation to of made some sort of sound if it had been a plane or a helicopter.  it flew in a straight line from south to north, and it never made any sharp turns.  we watched it for approximately 90 to 120 seconds, until it dissapeared from sight from the distance it had traveled.
content.summary: Me and my girlfriend saw a glowing orb shaped object flying south to north.

content.detailedDescription:
According to google maps, this is the location we were viewing from:

http://maps.Google.Com/maps?Q=40.90435,-72.527876&num=1&t=h&sll=40.904966,-72.528359&sspn=0.00433,0.006899&ie=utf8&ll=40.904966,-72.528359&spn=0.00433,0.006899&z=17

to begin: there were 2 separate sightings from the same vantage point about 15 minutes apart.

myself and a few friends and family members decided to go to the west landing beach on peconic bay and swim while viewing the fireworks.  from the beach you could see at least 10 different displays of fireworks.

it wasn't possible to see the sunset from where we were, but you could see the sky in the northeast getting red from it.  we were looking wnw or nw when we first saw the ufo.  there was a line of clouds maybe about 30 degs above the horizon.  otherwise the sky was pretty clear.  the ufo was just above this line of clouds from our vantage point.  we then were able to view it for a minute or so as it traveled to the east, skirting the top of the cloud line, and then we couldn't see it anymore.  it didn't go into the clouds or anything - we just couldn't pick it out of the sky anymore.  i have no idea how far away it was, but it seemed to move pretty quickly.  attached is a map with my best guess as to the location of the ufo while we viewed it.

15 minutes or later, a similar thing happened.  a ufo appeared in pretty much the same location as before, traveled at a similar speed along a similar trajectory, and disappeared from view in a similar place.  however, this one was shaped differently.

to describe the ufos:  both looked like shadows, or a darkening of the sky.  to view them you sometimes had to look away from them and see them with your peripheral vision.  another way to describe it would be if someone was using the clone stamp tool from photoshop in real time as we were watching.  it was a darkening/blurring that was different from the surrounding sky area.  we probably wouldn't have noticed it if it hadn't been moving.  the only difference between the 2 sightings were the shapes.  the first ufo was more cigar or line shaped and the second was round.  

all in all, there were 5 people who saw them in my group.  i think the reactions of everyone were along the lines of, "that was weird and cool!"
content.summary: Fireworks over peconic bay. two sightings about 15 minutes apart - looked like a shadow.

content.detailedDescription: On july 3rd i was in the town of portsmouth, n.H. watching the fireworks. when the fireworks got over i walked into town with some friends to meet other friends. i had sat down at a table in the center of town at a local coffee shop. it was a busy night as always. i was talking with a couple of people, when i looked up and saw this red glowing object. it looked to me a red balloon and the spot light from the church in town was shining off it, but the spot light was facing the other direction away from it. i kept looking at it and it was no doubt a red glowing object. the light was too big to be a plane flying by, plus it had no blinking lights of any kind. i pointed it to a friend and said what the heck is that, do you see that. he said he sees it and we pointed out to someone else. the other person we pointed it out to stated that its a ufo. they didn't say "oh its a plane or anything else", but a ufo. i watched it float past the buildings until it went behind some taller buildings. it stayed in the same direction and came back into view from around the buildings. i went and sat back down, because i didn't want people to think i was wierd. i got up 2 mins. later with a friend, because we were going home. he asked me where it was. i could still see it, but way further away. i pointed it out and then just stopped watching it. it was probably over the atlatic ocean by then. the red glowing object that i had seen was just floating by like a balloon, no odd movements. the funny thing is, is that i have seen the same type of glowing object last year and i thought it was bizzare. it was just about the same time on july 3rd after the fireworks. i was in a different part of town. i have seen some odd things around july 3rd and 4th. i notice that alot of people have reported orange or red glowing objects on this website from different areas of the us. that interests me, thank you.
content.summary: Seen red glowing object above buildings at low alttitude moving west to east. thought it was a red balloon with the light reflecting off it. as it moved into darker areas, i could see it was glowing.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i started watching the iss 2 years ago everytime it passed over our area.  on sept. 13, 2009 as i was setting up a telescope my wife told mw she was watching to lights at sattlelight height desending in a south westardly direction. i didn't look right away but when i did these two objects were about at approximately one thousand feet and desending at an unbelievable speed.  they leveled out at about 200 feet and flew over our two pine trees in the front of our house.  they procedded to jockey in an up and down manner in a southwestard direction.  they were both oval shape with a cut out section in the rear. they had a corrigated appearance with a dirty white lighted section on the bottom that didn't emit a glowing light but showed an inner-light.  they were 10 to 12 feet in diameter and 2 to 3 feet wide. these objects made no sound, none. we watched these two objects for about 5 to 7 seconds before they dissappeared. we both sat there speechless for about 15 to 20 minutes before we sais to each other what was that? did you see what i saw? will anybody believe us?  the following day my wifes best friend told my wife she saw two lights desending from the northeast to southwest over lake erie, before my wife told her of our sightings that very night.  i am an air force and army veteran and i never saw any aircraft fly at a speed and ease these two crafts flew. i have seen the x-15/x-18-f-4 phanthoms/ u-2/sr-71 fly and they couldn't keep up with these objects.  ten months later i am still in awh of what i saw that night.
content.summary: Two oval cut off in rear, from ne to sw, from satelite height down to 200ft.

content.detailedDescription: During a concert in downtown before the fireworks my wife pointed out a glowing red orb that was very high and stationary shortly after i took a lame picture of the event with my cell phone a small star looking light flew around the red orb. shortly afterwards the red orb went straight up and disappeared
content.summary: Red orb over downtown.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife, daughter, son and myself were sitting outside watching fireworks.

i was starring off into the sky (eastward) when my wife asked what something was and pointed towards the west.

i looked and it was a cross shaped ufo that was glowing red and orange.

at first i figured it was a firework.

it hovered for 3 or 4 minutes before moving around sporadically.

it then faded away towards the west.

we also noticed 3 + air planes flying towards where the ufo faded away.

the only reason i'm reporting this is because so many other people seem to have seen the same thing.

i posted this story on my facebook account the night it happened.
content.summary: Burning floating cross.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were sitting on the lawn watching the fireworks at our buddies place. when at 10:27:12 i noticed a bright red glowing spherical object in the northwest sky. at first i thought it may  of been a helicopter or plane flying into sea-tac airport. i was sort of fascinated at because i thought it odd that the craft was not using normal aviation beacons and the craft appeared to be stationary and pulsating from red to orange. all of a sudden the craft moved from stationary to a horizontal left and then went stationary again. i grabbed my wifes attention and pointed out the object to her which now appeared to be moving away from us and in a horizontal circular motion (clockwise). the craft then pulsated and increased it's altitude vertically. the craft appeared to begin to fade in and out as if flying thru low level clouds but then it appeared bright and then it faded out and disappeared all together. i made the comment to my wife, that was exactly what happened last 4th of july at my parents house at about 10ish in the evening (also reported the sighting to mufon). she made a wise crack and i down played her as i turned around the craft suddenly reappeared to the left of a tree (my wife pointed out the re-appearing this time) bright red and then bright orange and it moved slowly behind the tree in a left to right direction. when the craft re-emerged from behind the tree it continued it's horizontal movement in a very slow yet steady direction of east to west it was flashing red orange then it began to fade out then it just disappeared all together. well i thought that was the end of it as i sat down in my chair roughly 45 seconds later i noticed in the southwest skyline at about tree level the craft had re-appeared again. this time brighter and larger it was moving from a southerly to northerly direction it went behind the tree line and then it raised up above the tree line and faded out all together. i checked the time at the end of the event and marked it at 10:36:42pm. 

i am going to take a photo with descriptions of where the object(s) were in the sky and i will submit them for viewing.
content.summary: Brilliant orange/red spheres.

content.detailedDescription:
On the way back home from grocery stores , i kept my eye on the sky around the setting sun , as through my observations of ufos they do like to "gather" around this time . sure enough first i've noticed a large cotton ball like light sphere higher a bit than the sun & to the right of it . i've set my grocery bags on the ground & took out my camera . when i've aimed it at this sphere for a brief second i thought i seen it as metallic ship , so i lifted the camera & looking at the screen i took the photo . (this ship was visible on the screen , yet when i looked at it in the sky it looked as a much dimmer light now, obviously i thought my eyes maybe played tricks since i was looking at the sky & afterwards i had a huge dark blob in font of my eyes for few minutes). i really thought something would show up once put on iphoto but to my amazement there was absolutely nothing in that specific area , which suprised me a great deal , since even light orb ships photograph beautifully ! the only way this could have happened (i think) that at the moment i pressed the button the ufo was in the process of changing its appearance again . the ufo was as the person's photo # 2 in the report id # 24242 :-)
however , when i zoomed in on the computer trying to see if the ufo is hiding in the illuminated clouds somewhere in the photo , it sure was there , a large white ball . than i brought that segment even closer & adjusted sharpness , contrast , etc , & there it popped out several small orbs in addition to that large one ! i was elated at seeing it . 
i'm attaching the original photograph & the zoomed in modified copy of what i just described so your investigators can have a go at it .
the photo was taken at exactly 6:43:33 pm . ( before i took this image i watched it for approximately 3 minutes or so ).
once at home later i took another photo through the window this time but nothing really showed up on the computer except 3 high up in the w & another solitary one on the way to n direction .
content.summary: Seen the same ufo as the person's reported event id# 24242.

content.detailedDescription: I noticed the other sighting near gravois bluffs and had to report it. while driving on highway 141 south away from gravois bluffs about two or three miles, we noticed a floating orb looking orange object at the intersection of highway 141 and 21. it seemed not to be moving and was very near some fireworks stands. i also like the other poster thought it looked somewhat like a balloon but as we passed under it did not appear to that. it was witnessed by both my wife and three daughters. it was odd i know that.
content.summary: Sphere orange and white color.

content.detailedDescription: We witnessed a total of four occurrences of visitor activity on the 4th of july 2010 in the lake forest subdivision of huntsville alabama.  at 8:50 pm we saw a single reddish orange glowing orb coming from the south moving slowing northward; it was very low, maybe 250 to 300' above the rooftops.  there was absolutely no sound being emitted from the illuminating sphere.  we watched it for about 5-10 minutes as it passed over our neighborhood and then got into our car and drove to the gas station at the corner of martin and zerdt roads.  we could see fireworks off in the distance so we sat in the car for about 15 minutes and watched.  as we drove home heading west on martin road, we saw a formation of we couldn���t believe it when we saw a formation of 3 glowing orbs.  this time i really thought, hey these things are extraterrestrial and i want to make sure there not hot air balloons or helicopters.  so we slowed down to almost a complete stop, rolled down the windows to see if we could hear helicopter blades, but there was no sound at all.  and they were not hot air balloons.  we had traffic behind us, so we had to move on and we are not sure where they went, but assume they continued to move northward as did the first one.  we were sitting outside and then around 10 pm we saw one more solitary glowing orb, but at a higher altitude then the others and this one was either blinking, or something behind it was blinking and we watched it move northward as well, then the dog barked, we looked away and when we looked up again it had disappeared.  then about 15 minutes later my boyfriend said, look at that satellite.  and i said, where?  then i exclaimed, wow, did you see that? he said i sure did, wow!  we saw four distinct bright lights that looked like stars that were kind of in a cluster at first and then formed into a line and just zip off into space.  it made warp speed seem slow, they just zipped up and off into space and where gone.  neither of us had ever witnessed anything like this before.  we believe that since the orbs were so slow moving and close to the ground there must have been a number of others who saw the same thing on that clear 4th of july night in huntsville, alabama.
content.summary: Glowing reddish orange orbs moving slowing at about 200 to 300' above rooftops.

content.detailedDescription: monday night, july 5th at approx. 8:45p.M.,my girlfriend and i were walking in lenox village, a fairly new residential area off of nolensville road in south nashville. it was a beautiful, clear night and the stars were just beginning to dot the sky. as we walked, i noticed a bright light coming from the south heading north. i thought it was a helicopter. we stopped to look as it got closer. only then did we realize that there was no engine noise. it was totally silent. when the object got close enough to us, approx. 1000 yards to the east, and flying at the height and speed of a small plane, we could see a faint, dark circular shape with a bright orange ball of light underneath. the light looked to be attached to the object. as it passed us, it started heading in a more northeast direction. suddenly, the orange light disappeared and we saw the dark circular shape stop it's forward motion and descend from the sky beyond the treeline, and out of our view. we both got pretty excited about what we had just witnessed and continued walking. a minute or two later, i mentioned that i would love to see that again and looked over my right shoulder in the direction where i first saw the light. incredibly, there was another. exactly the same. it followed the same path and we watched the orange light go out and the dark circle go down behind the trees in the same area. well, we were both blown away. we decided to sit on a nearby bench and keep an eye out for more. after about 10 minutes we watched as a real helicopter, noisy as hell btw, flew into the area and seemed to be looking for something. we left after a few more minutes of watching. we don't know what it was that we saw. i just know that i had never seen anything like it before.
content.summary: Circular shaped with a bright orange non-blinking light underneath.

content.detailedDescription: At the end of the event something of another appeared that was unknown to me, but i could feel the presence of shinigami, a god like being striking the earth and creating a rift. and at the tenth second of the last minute a huge explosion, tearing the sky apart. the explosion knocked me back unconscious. when i awoke,everything was back to normal.
content.shape: Blimp,   Boomerang,   Bullet,   Missile,   Cigar,   Cone,   Chevron,   Circle,   Cross,   Cylinder,   Diamond,   Disc,   Egg,   Fireball,   Flash,   Oval,   Saturn-like,   Sphere,   Square,   Rectagular,   Star-like,   Teardrop,   Triangle,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: It was very dramatic. a bunch of shapes in the sky were fluttering around in the sky. they were all different and unique.

content.detailedDescription: i live south of cleveland ohio and witnessed this on the evening of july 4,2010. my brother in law and i were outside in my backyard celebrating the fourth of july.  we had just finished a yard game and sat down on the deck to take a break.  we were of course looking up at the sky to see the fireworks and then noticed a strange looking object.  it was an orange oval shaped object moving very slowly from southwest to northeast.  we both looked at each other because we knew this was out of the ordinary.  i thought it may have been a plane in trouble, but it didn't lose altitude it kept the same speed and altitude.  then as we kept looking at it a red dot came at it from above at high speed, we were completely amazed at this point. it almost looked like it was going to intercept it, but when it got close it ( red dot ) kept going in a northerly direction. the orange sphere finally flew out of sight towards the northeast leaving us scratching our heads.  i'm glad my brother in law was there to see it with me so people don;t think i'm crazy.
content.summary: Glowing orange sphere moving slowly.

content.detailedDescription: We were at a party of around 125 people and we were lighting off fireworks, and we saw these steady moving fire balls, they were not flickering, just one after another, total of around 5  , no noise, same speed, same path, very strange.  were not fire works  , we tried to take a picture, but they would not show up on our camera.  i have seen reports all over about these things. have you heard what they are?
content.summary: Orange lights flying in sky over thurston county.

content.detailedDescription:
I initially witnessed these same objects on july 4, 2010 and so decided to see if i could see any on this night. 
indeed, after about 30 minutes i observed a bright star-like object move in a random pattern across the sky. several more followed from almost every direction possible over a period of approx 2 hrs for a total of 8 objects. 
however, two significant events occurred. the first being when several objects in the sky began to flash (white light) from different points in the sky, as if it were a form of communication? the second when one of these objects emitted a bright flash, directly east from it appeared as if something exploded as there were two bright flashes which lingered momentarily prior to fading. 
i was excited yesterday, as was my family. now, it's overwhelming, this is not anything i expected or feel comfortable with, it's difficult to explain - just crazy but i know what i saw and i'm more than concerned and this is out of my element.
i'm reporting it because i know it has to be impossible that someone else would not have seen it too!
i do not have a high powered camera but did catch something odd on camera, i don't expect it to be a bombshell but at this point who the heck knows
content.summary: Several objects seen over naugatuck valley.

content.detailedDescription: outside with girlfriend watching fireworks when i saw a bright orange light that didn't blink but it pulsated.  it was so bright it just caught my eye.  it went from south to north and flew low.  once i knew it wasn't a plane i told my girlfriend to look at it.  we continued to watch it for another 30 or forty seconds, when it flashed and disappeared.  i had enough time to grab my phone and record it but the quality of the lens doesn't allow it to be visible.  i have never seen anything like this in my life.  i got online right after last night but didn't want to sound like a freak.  the video does have an exact time but its so dark that it didn't pick it up.
content.summary: Orange ball flying low south to north appeared on fire then flashed and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
We were outside shooting fireworks when we first saw the ball of light. at first we discredited it just thinking it had to be something with the fireworks. but then about 15 mins later it came right back but this time moved forward and backwards. we couldn't believe what we were seeing. about 20 mins later we drove right down the street to the local mcdonalds and as we were in the drive through we saw it again!!!! not only did we spot it but so did the mcdonalds employee...We held the line up just watching the object until it disappeared. when we got home we decided to go "looking" or "hunting" the object to see if we could spot it again. we were able to spot the object 4 additional times at different locations around the house.

when we first left the house we decided to go back to mcdonald's to see if we could find in and sure enough it showed back up! we were able to follow it for approximatly 1.5 miles until we lost it in the trees. we continued to ride around and saw it just appear then disappear. another time it appeared, shot across the sky at a very fast speed and then disappeared. we were about to head home when we spotted it again, it hovered for about 1-2 mins then disappeared.

i know what i saw was not a firework, sky lantern or anything normal that can be explained. maybe if i just saw it once i would question myself but with us searching for it and seeing it as many times as we did, it is undeniable! 

i know this is going to sound crazy but i feel like the object knew we were watching it. it seemed as soon as we started talking about it it disappear would shortly. i'm not crazy i have 4 additional witnesses.
content.summary: Bright ball of orange light.

content.detailedDescription:
/when we first saw it it was pretty close. it seemed as if it noticed that we saw it.It slowly started moving south, and then slow disappear. we kept watching the sky and then before we know it it appeared again. it stayed it placed for a few, it was as if the ball was watching the fireworks, then it disappeared and then about 10 mins. later it was back and then disappeared.. i tried to take a pic with cell phone but cant really see it. but i still have it....There were about 15 people who saw it...
/
content.summary: Big red-orang ball.

content.detailedDescription:
July 2 2010 11:50pm


for the canada day long weekend my family of four and nephew went camping a few km west of kennedy lake (about 40 4m east of tofino bc) . years ago my wife and i had spotted a ufo at kennedy lake while joking about one shining a flashlight into the sky. so since we were back in the same area we figure it would be fun try it again. so on the first clear night (2nd of july) once it became dark we started playing around with the red laser pointer and led mag flashlight. writing things in the sky and blinking them on and off etc. at 11:50pm directly over head we saw two bright white lights appear one traveling south to north the other traveling west to east. they quickly crossed paths then the ufo traveling north either disappears or traveled out of sight behind the tree cover. i could not tell for sure which. the opening in the trees above our heads was small so it was not in view for more than a a second or two. the the object traveling west to east we watched travel straight until it was out of sight in the distance (total time was about 2min 10 sec). it may have slowed down further away but it was difficult to tell. my wife did try and take a video of it with our camera but unfortunately it is not a very good camera for such things and the video looks like a star...Nothing like we saw in person. another interesting note is that after the ufo passed over, my wife went to check the time on her cellphone which was off since there is to cell service where we were camped. she took it out of the purse and it was on and had service. the phone was definitely off previously and it can not be accidentally turned on. she turned it off then back on and there was no service again. very strange.


here are my very rough estimates of the ufo:


approximate altitude 1000'

approximate speed 1800km/h i may be overestimating. 

no sound emitted at anytime.

no smoke or contrail.

it was a very bright pure white light. which seemed a bit dimmer in the center.

i do not think it was perfectly rounds but close.


if i held a 1 1/4��� diameter object at arms length that would be about the size of the objects directly over head. at 1000' alt i believe that would work out to roughly 500' in dia. these numbers could be off by a fair bit since it is very hard to estimate the size and distance of an object that i do not know what it is.


i am 100% certain this was not a meteorite, satellite, known aircraft...Or weather balloon.


since i am not sure what the international space station looks like from earth i thought i would look it out.

nasa's website states that the international space station passed over port alberni (100 km east of our position) on fri jul 02 11:40 pm for a duration of 4 minutes

max elevation 71deg approach 16 above wnw departure 20 above e


what you'll see:
assuming the station is in sunlight, it should appear as a bright and fast moving star. the longest the station will remain in view to a ground based observer is 4 minutes. when passing directly overhead, the station zips from horizon to horizon is 240 seconds or less. for most locations, the viewing window will be 120 seconds (or less).

the time is close but the space station definitely is not what we seen either.
content.summary: Ufo fly by while searching for one.

content.detailedDescription: Me, my wife and neighbor couple seen it high and bright in the sky heading west to east across southern fort wayne, in. it lasted about 60 to 90 seconds. it had no sound, no smoke, no trail, no blinking lights, just one bright orange light moving to slow to be a falling or shooting star, to fast for aircraft, no tail like a meteor. then my son told me today about the bright orange light he seen on the 4th of july. i had to write once i found out it went over 140 miles away. not an aircraft, not at all.
content.summary: Very bright orange.
